meanings.definition: A person who is easily deceived or tricked.
meanings.sent1: The salesman saw the rubes coming from a mile away.
meanings.sent2: The rubes fell for the scam without hesitation.
meanings.sent3: The rubes thought they won a free vacation, but it was just a prank.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a rube when she realized she had been tricked into buying a fake watch.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the smooth-talking con artist, he preys on unsuspecting rubes.

meanings.definition: A group of people who are unsophisticated or naive.
meanings.sent1: The small town was full of rubes who believed everything they heard.
meanings.sent2: The rubes in the crowd cheered at the magician's simple tricks.
meanings.sent3: The city slicker couldn't help but chuckle at the rubes' innocent questions.
meanings.sent4: In the land of the rubes, the charlatan was king.
meanings.sent5: The rubes' wide-eyed wonder at the fireworks display was endearing.
